intro: Geigeria intermedia, commonly known as the African feverfew, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Geigeria intermedia is known for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional African medicine.
